title: Project Officer for Sustainable Forest Management
job_description:
Duty station: Ha Noi 
Duration: Starting from ASAP to 30 June 2025 with option for extension

Main tasks: 
• Provide technical advice and on-the-job support to partnering forest companies, Protection Forest Management Boards (PFMBs), training institutions and other partners at provincial or central level in sustainable forest management including operation of timber plantations, timber value chains, forest and climate finance, forest carbon, wind risks and pests in plantations, forest and biodiversity protection in close cooperation with the service provider involved in the implementation of the project
• Supports the digitalization of training modules in close exchange with forest training institutes and other service providers for capacity development for sustainable forest management
• Conceptualization, preparation and implementation of activities, studies, events and trips including drafting and presenting concept notes, writing ToR for external experts, quality assurance of deliverables, and stakeholder liaison.
• Design, preparation and implementation of workshops, seminars and other events including participant management
• Ensures that activities are aligned with project objectives and principles as well as coherence among activities within other work packages
• Liaison and coordination with partners, consultants, and target group in the area of responsibility
• Coordination of project activities (design and quality control of activities), including technical supervision and coordination of the contracting procedures for consultants in close cooperation with other service providers involved in the implementation of the project 
• Conducts structured and regular monitoring in their working area, contributes to overall reporting and knowledge management
• Compiles, reviews and enhances project reports and products for distribution and publication
• Capitalizes on potentials to make positive contributions to gender equality in working area in close coordination with gender focal points.
• Prepares materials in English and Vietnamese and supports with translations and interpretation as required
• Performs other duties and tasks at the request of management
requirements:
• Master’s degree in forestry, environmental economics, natural resources management, sustainable development, environmental studies or similar
• 4 years of experience in the forestry, environmental economics, or natural resource sector;
• 2 years of experience in international and technical development cooperation related to sustainable forest management;
• 2 years of experience in working with Government institutions related to sustainable forest management;
• Sound understanding of the Vietnamese context related to sustainable forest management
• Ability to work in a structured, self-organized way and working autonomously.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Vietnamese and English
• Willingness to travel to project sites for work within Vietnam and possibly for short trips abroad, if necessary;
• Good digital literacy including knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and willingness to work with digital tools such as MS teams for day-to-day work. Understanding of e-learning platforms such as Moodle and modelling approaches is an advantage
• Ability to work effectively as a team member, cooperatively and support other team members, show initiative when required 
• Ability to manage multiple demands and prioritise tasks, trouble-shoot, and to meet short- and long-term deadlines 
• Flexibility and willingness to perform other duties and work irregular hours when required 
• Excellent interpersonal skills, including patience, diplomacy, willingness to listen and show respect for colleagues 

GIZ is committed to create an appreciative work environment, irrespective of age, ethnic background and nationality, gender and gender identity, physical and mental abilities, religion and worldview, sexual orientation and social background. We ensure human resource processes live up to the diverse competencies and talents of all employees, as well as satisfy our performance expectations.

What we can offer to the successful candidates: 
• Good working environment 
• Competitive compensation and benefit packages such as contribution of all compulsory insurances, providing with the additional health care, the annual health check-up and the 24-hours accident insurance. 
• Covering all travel expenses with travel allowances when traveling on business
• And good policy on training and development 
• And policy on flexible working time 

Interested qualified candidates are invited to send the GIZ Application Form in English, copies of relevant certificates and references, either by email or by post (to GIZ Office Hanoi, 6th Floor Hanoi Towers, 49 Hai Ba Trung Street, Hanoi, Vietnam) before 29th April 2024. 
Note: Please state “Application for the Project Officer for Sustainable Forest Management – SFM” in the subject line or on the envelope. The short-listed candidates will be contacted within 4 weeks after the deadline. Telephone contact is not encouraged.
Please visit our page GIZ Viet Nam – Career Opportunities at 
https://www.giz.de/en/worldwide/109163.html to download the GIZ Application Form.

job_description:

- Xây dựng, phổ biến và thực thi các chính sách, thực tiễn và quy trình cho việc đánh giá nguy cơ và điều tra tai nạn.
- Theo dõi các rủi ro liên quan đến sức khỏe và an toàn hiện có và tiềm tàng tại nơi làm việc, tham gia vào các buổi đánh giá nguy cơ cấp doanh nghiệp và phát triển, phê duyệt các biện pháp kiểm soát cho các nguy cơ đã xác định.

- Provide adequate training to employees on work-related safety.
- Manage emergency procedures required during work operations.
- Develop procedures for reporting workplace accidents.
- Offer remote advice and guidance to management on removing potential hazards.
- Create, circulate, and enforce policies, practices, and procedures for hazard assessment and accident investigation.
- Monitor current and potential health and safety risks in the workplace, participate in hazard assessments, and develop controls for identified hazards.
- Organize and coordinate training programs for employees to maintain knowledge, awareness, and preparedness.
- Ensure all onsite organizations and suppliers are aware of their safety obligations and legislative requirements.
- Establish relationships with local authorities and organizations to implement HSSE systems effectively.

title: Finance Manager - New Position - Binh Duong Province
job_description:
With a strong global brand name and manufacturing presence, our clients pride themselves on high performance, reliable products, and services. With more expansion coming up, they are seeking a highly qualified Finance Manager to support their finance team and drive commercial activity across all markets as they prepare to expand further.


Description

1 Apply comprehensive accounting principles and practices

 * Directs and monitors a variety of accounting activities to ensure the company's financial resources are managed in accordance with accounting principles and comply with all relevant regulations, laws, and standards.
 * Review financial reports and accounting statements to ensure accuracy.
 * Make sure regional practice aligned with Corporate and Divisional requirements for quarter ends and year end (including annual updates)
 * Responsible for in scope accounting reconciliation review & intercompany company profit elimination
 * Develop, analyze and review regional reports

 1 Rollout global policies and procedures

 * Closely engage with corporate GSC finance group to rollout global policies and procedures to ensure compliance with financial management principles and practices and applicable laws, rules, and regulations; Make sure no obligation with local GAAP
 * Support corporate inventory management initiatives including LIFO, material efficiency, physical inventories and cycle counting
 * Responsible for transactional accounting within ERP setup and Standard/Forecast costing. Includes annual standard conversion cost development and system update of new year costs.

 1 Work with senior leadership as well as the operations team, supply Chain, IT, auditors and finance management

 * Responds to questions and concerns from senior management regarding financial operations and results, performs research, and provides recommendations or opinions.
 * Provides technical expertise and advice to functional or operational areas managers to help them develop revenue and expense budgets, understand financial reports, and manage their financial responsibilities.
 * Problem solving with all functional areas to support efficient and accurate use of the ERP and reporting tools. (eg day to day trouble shooting activities where often work with plant management to require certain processing steps to ensure accurate accounting/variances/visibility of transactions. Such as use of tollers, account mapping/reason codes, product setup questions, etc.)
 * CAPEX investment analysis to support site operation capacity and business growth.

 1 Supervise employees including hiring, training, and performance evaluations

 * Supervises staff to include hiring, training, evaluating performance, providing compensation recommendations, and determining disciplinary actions when necessary.
 * Leads, directs, evaluates, and develops a team of accounting professionals to ensure accounting activities are completed accurately and on time.
 * Manages functions that may include product costing; customer pricing accounts payable; general ledger maintenance; financial analysis and reporting; budgeting, and asset accounting

 1 Business partner for OPS/Supply Chain/ Site admin

 * Responsible for monthly closing, reporting and tolling forecast and annual operation plan

 1 Support the audit(external/internal), annual Physical Inventory count arrangement.
 2 Provide support for other finance team related to costing/inventory. (statutory report)
 3 Lead projects within responsible scope, eg total supply chain cost study, NEW CAPEX etc.
 4 Guide team be familiar with local GAAP, Tax regulation and accounting practice cross SEA countries.
 5 Ad hoc site finance KPI analysis, task assigned from leader.


Profile

* Bachelors Degree in Accounting or Finance, preferred CPA or CMA
 * 7 years of progressive accounting experience, 2 years of supervisory experience.
 * 6-8 years, manufacturing finance/accounting experience preferred.
 * The ability to quickly identify subtle patterns among issues.
 * Proficiency in Excel Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook and 11i knowledge.
 * Mindset to accept challenge from change.
 * Experience in Oracle for Costing, GL, PE module.


Job Offer

* Transformative position

Tốt nghiệp Đại học chuyên ngành liên quan Truyền thông, Báo chí, Marketing

• Khả năng nhận biết và đánh giá rủi ro.

title: 2024 Graduate Management Trainee GMT - BU Southeast Asia
job_description:
Our greatest strength is our people. And we believe that great people should grow at the pace of their talent and be rewarded accordingly. If you´re ready for your next move within AB Inbev, we´re sure we can find an opportunity to get you out of your comfort zone. After all, at AB Inbev, Challenge Accepted isn´t just a phrase, it´s a mindset..

AB INBEV GRADUATE MANAGEMENT TRAINEE PROGRAM (GMT)

We unleash potential. Our Graduate Management Trainee (GMT) Program is an important pipeline to unleash that potential - developing future leaders to ensure our business is ready to meet the moment. Since inception, our GMT program has resulted in over 2,300 hires globally – many leaving a lasting legacy – and we are excited to continue developing top talent that will enable us to achieve our purpose of creating a future with more cheers.
We dream big to create a future with more cheers. We invest in potential, not just credentials. We look for people with passion, curiosity, courage and resilience to make a deep impact and create a lasting legacy in our company. We welcome diverse talent because great ideas come from people with different backgrounds.
If this sounds like you, then we encourage you to apply to our Graduate Management Trainee (GMT) Program. We believe in investing in our future leaders today and through a structured, 12-months program giving hands on business experience and a deeper look into our operations, our program is designed to fast track the careers of the brightest, most driven university graduates.
OUR GMT PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS

Our GMT program is rooted in our culture and company strategy. We achieve this by putting the trainees through an structured experiences related to each of our three strategic pillars – (1) Lead and Grow the Category, (2) Digitize and Monetize Our Ecosystem, and (3) Optimize our Business. Experiences should not be limited to but include exposure opportunities in our Sales, Supply/Logistics and Marketing functions. Trainees should be fully mobile within BU SEA and expect to be placed in a front line (e.g., sales, supply chain) role after completing the program.

3-4 month rotations, with each experience aligned to our three strategic pillars. Ideally in Marketing, Sales or Tech, and Supply / Logistics.
Projects within these rotations that expand knowledge and work on actual business challenges in each of these core functions.
Cheers! Festival (Global Induction) where GMTs will hear about our company strategy first-hand from our most senior leaders, and network with peers.
Access to global GMT alumni database.
Potential for experiences in different locations across zone (mobility within zone required).
Formal mentoring & access to unique zone L&D curricula.
Unique exposure opportunities with senior leaders.
Career tracking by zone People Continuity and Talent Management teams.
Upon successful completion of the 12-month rotational program, you will take on an entry-level management position in any function depending on your profile, interest and results. You will also receive a mentor from the executive team when you start in your first position.
requirements:
You should graduate (by 2024) with a Bachelor, Masters (or equivalent) degree. You should also have no more than 2 years of professional experience (Note: internships/volunteers/student jobs not included).
You will need to be fluent in English.
You will need a valid visa/work permit to be eligible for the program in the country you are applying for (Vietnam & Thailand).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel) and ability to quickly adapt to new systems.
Geographical mobility – you will move to different locations during the 12-month training program, and you should be willing to relocate throughout your career.
You are able to start working full-time from August 2024.

Please be advised that you will only be considered for the first application you submit, therefore please make sure you are completely happy with your choice as this decision is final.

To learn more about our rankings, please check out our latest facts and figures here Reputation and rankings - RMIT University 

Rewards and Benefits:

- 13th month Tet bonus + private medical insurance (for you and your dependents) + annual health check.
- Generous annual leave, career leave and public holidays (Christmas and Tet Holidays)

- Access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources

RMIT Vietnam has been honoured with the respectable HR Asia Award as Top Employer To Work For in Asia. To find out more about RMIT Vietnam and our current vacancies, please visit our website: https://www.rmit.edu.vn/careers

YOUR ROLE
This position is responsible for operating the machines and labs for SSET programs in Hanoi. The role will ensure SSET labs are well maintained and organized so that students have access to equipment which is in good working order to complete projects in compliance with laboratory rules and guidelines. This position also provides high-level technical support to staff and students in the safe operation and use of our equipment and facilities.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Maintain the equipment (Elvis/Adruino boards, 3D printers, etc).
2. Deliver workshops for students using the AMW.
3. Deliver Occupational Health & Safety (OHS) training for new students; review and approve student's risk assessment form before performing any lab activities.
4. Provide high-level technical support and advice to staff and students in development, operation and safe use of engineering equipment.
5. Maintain laboratories and laboratory equipment in a ready, serviceable, clean and safe condition to aid the Schools educational activities, including organizing preventive maintenance service, troubleshooting and repairs where required.
6. Create and maintain accurate manuals, records, and procedures for the School’s equipment and facilities. 
7. Provide regular reports and propose solutions to the Manager, Planning & Operations and SPMs regarding equipment that needs to be repaired or replaced, inventory, and process issues.
8. Provide expert advice for procurement of new equipment, hardware/software tools and materials/components, as well as setting up of equipment/tools service contracts. 
9. Staying updated with the latest developments in relevant technologies and OHS guidelines.
10. Lead initiatives related to SSET labs and teaching facilities.
11. Other technical duties as determined by line manager and SPMs.
requirements:
KEY SELECTION CRITERIA 
1. Bachelor degree relevant to engineering and/or science. 
2. Experienced in running an engineering or academic department laboratory.
3. Experienced in running Elvis/Adruino boards, 3D printers
4. Good general technical knowledge and practical skills - soldering, basic electronic circuit design.
5. Assemble/solder low powered leads for laboratory equipment.
6. Demonstrated knowledge of current Occupational Health & Safety legislation, regulations and practices as well as relevant experience in their implementation.
7. Demonstrated ability to contribute to and work as part of a collaborative team committed to creating and managing signature partnerships that enhance the University’s strategic development goals. 
8. Demonstrated ability to quickly establish productive, collaborative relationships with people at all levels, both internal and external to the university. 
9. Well-developed interpersonal skills, including cross cultural communication and business writing skills.
10. Ability to multi-task with forward planning capability and meticulous attention to detail.
11. Demonstrated ability to service clients and provide client-centred solutions.
12. Ability to work under pressure and unfailingly meet deadlines.

ENGLISH PROFICIENCY 
English is the language of teaching and communication at RMIT Vietnam. For this role, the minimum requirement is IELTS (General) with a score of at least 6.0 or equivalent, as outlined in the RMIT Recruitment, Selection and Onboarding Guidelines.

job_description:
• Lead and enhance end to end S&OP process to drive business decision for growth. Drive value discussion, scenario planning, risk/opportunities with stakeholders.

• Develops and maintains detailed inventories of materials and supplies located in the company and in the factory.

Follows up the periodical controls of the fire extinguishers, sends them to fill up / maintenance and responsible for settlement of the fire extinguishers that have been filled up and returned to their places. Ensures making technical maintenance, controls and examinations that are required by the legislations and regulations periodically in time. Supervises the activities of periodical maintenance control/maintenance attitude that are outsourced by HSE group. Keeps records about periodical controls that are made within the scope of Fire Safety.
• Responsible for organization and implementation of the necessary applications in the workplace according to Fire Safety legislations.
• Responsible for creating / performing the corrective and preventive actions.
• Responsible for following the instructions determined by management systems when entering to field (hygiene, health and safety, information security, process safety)
• Performs preventive actions for continuous improvement to prevent employees from health and safety and environmental risks. Joins relevant safety committee meetings.

• Initiate corrective action requests on QDMS when find non-compliances in processes and reply to corrective action requests timely on QDMS.

title: HR Manager
job_description:
1. Team Management and Strategy (50%):

• Manage and prepare employee contracts, job descriptions, KPIs, and contract annexes…

• Prepare and submit reports to government institutions for compliance.
- Employee Performance Evaluation:
• Monitor and update employee performance evaluations.
• Report on underperforming employees and ensure appropriate actions are taken.
- Training and Development:
• Assess training needs and implement training programs.
• Coordinate company-wide training, manage attendance, and issue schedules.
• Facilitate change processes through coaching and initiatives.
- Compliance Management:
• Ensure the organization's compliance with regulations and report violations.
- Reporting:
• Provide monthly HR reports to the BoD .
• Include HR turnover rate, the average time to fill positions, HR efficiency, and costs, employee performance, and identified issues.
- Additional Responsibilities:
• Handle other HR-related tasks assigned by the BoD.

- Review and evaluate weekly, monthly, and quarterly recruitment reports.

title: Marketing Senior Manager/ Associate Director (Head of Department)
job_description:
Department: Marketing Communications
Report to: Board of Management.


We are seeking a dynamic Marketing Senior Manager/Associate Director with a proven track record of crafting compelling brand narratives and leading creative initiatives. The primary focus of this role is to spearhead the creation and development of a new brand story. This initiative aims to refresh our traditional way of communicating about business, our brand image, engaging with customers, and driving increased brand recognition and customer loyalty.


Key Responsibilities
• Develop and implement a comprehensive marketing strategy, especially brand story that aligns with the company's values and overall business goals, resonates with target audiences, and sets the foundation for the company’s future marketing and brand goals. Ensure the brand becomes a top recognized and trusted name in the industry
• Lead the conceptualization, design, and development of a compelling story that embodies the essence of our brand and appeals to our target customers
• Translate business objective to communication strategy, creative/media brief
• Drive performance in Digital Marketing, Content Marketing aligned with company strategic direction.
• Optimize marketing channels for maximum brand exposure and engagement
• Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to develop, execute CONTENT MARKETING campaigns, KOL/KOC partnership, and sponsorships that drive brand awareness, user acquisition

• Lead, develop, and manage Marketing Team members, establishing an effective marketing organizational structure with the right capabilities to deliver results
• Other tasks assigned by Board of Management.
requirements:

• A minimum of 8 years of Marketing Communications/Branding experience, with a focus on brand strategy, storytelling, idea generation and creative development

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders
• Must be a self-starter, highly organized, and able to work well with all levels in the organization. Polished presentation and interpersonal skills. Good communication and presentation skills in English and Vietnamese. Good command of Microsoft Office and Windows-based computer applications.

title: Chuyên Viên Phát Triển Phần Mềm SAP (ABAP)
job_description:
*** Chức năng/Mục tiêu công việc
Tập trung vào việc phát triển và tối ưu hóa hệ thống SAP
- Lập trình các ứng dụng và tính năng mới trong hệ thống SAP bằng ngôn ngữ lập trình ABAP
- Thực hiện kiểm thử và tối ưu mã nguồn, cải thiện hiệu suất hệ thống

*** Trách nhiệm/Nhiệm vụ chính: 
I Giai đoạn triển khai phần mềm SAP
1 Phát triển và tùy chỉnh các ứng dụng SAP sử dụng ABAP. 
- Có kiến thức cơ bản về ứng dụng SAP, biết sử dụng phân hệ ABAP để lập trình.
2 Tạo ra các báo cáo, giao diện, và phần mở rộng hệ thống. 
- Có khả năng đưa ra giải pháp, lập trình, kiểm thử, đóng gói và triển khai các tính năng theo yêu cầu mở rộng.
3 Thực hiện kiểm thử và tối ưu hóa mã nguồn. 
- Đọc hiểu mã nguồn, quy tắc kiểm thử, triển khai mã nguồn ABAP

II Giai đoạn vận hành phần mềm SAP
1 Bảo trì và cập nhật mã nguồn ABAP. 
- Đảm bảo mã nguồn được cập nhật theo các tiêu chuẩn mới nhất và tuân thủ best practices

- Khả năng phân tích, am hiểu nghiệp vụ, thiết kế giải pháp cho các tính năng mới

- Khả năng thu thập thông tin, theo dõi, phối hợp với đơn vị cung cấp CNTT để xử lý các vấn đề kỹ thuật phát sinh liên quan đến hệ thống.
III Thực hiện các nhiệm vụ khác theo sự phân công của Trưởng phòng và Lãnh đạo Công ty. 

*** Quyền hạn:
- Quyền làm việc chặt chẽ với các phòng ban khác để hiểu rõ yêu cầu và cung cấp giải pháp phù hợp.
- Quyền cập nhật kiến thức và kỹ năng của mình thông qua đào tạo để thích ứng với công nghệ mới và môi trường làm việc nhanh chóng.
- Quyền chủ động thực hiện các công việc trong bản mô tả công việc. 
- Quyền phản hồi về chỉ tiêu và kết quả đánh giá thực hiện công việc.
requirements:

- Trình độ chuyên môn 
+ Tốt nghiệp Cao đẳng, Đại học chính quy liên quan đến ngành CNTT
+ Ưu tiên tốt nghiệp ngành phát triển phần mềm.
- Kinh nghiệm công tác: Tối thiểu 2 năm
- Kiến thức 
+Kỹ năng lập trình, debugging sử dụng phân hệ ABAP
+Kiến thức về SAP với các phân hệ chính FICO, PP, MM và SD
+Kiến thức về cơ sở dữ liệu: SQL, Oracle
+Kinh nghiệm phát triển, kiểm thử và cài đặt chương trình ABAP trong SAP S/4HANA
Có kiến thức về SAP Cloud Platform, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model là một lợi thế.

+Kỹ năng phân tích tổng hợp.
+Kỹ năng làm việc độc lập.
- Phẩm chất cá nhân 
+Có trách nhiệm với công việc, làm việc nghiêm túc, nhanh nhẹn, nhiệt tình, khả năng làm việc độc lập cao, sẵn sàng học hỏi tiếp thu các kiến thức, khái niệm mới.

title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst
job_description:
Summary:

A Senior Supply Chain Analyst analyzes data and methods to predict and improve a company’s delivery of products and services to its customers. An organization’s supply chain needs to run smoothly and efficiently to ensure a profit, making the supply chain analyst an essential role. Analysts use data to support recommendations for optimizing the methods within the company in terms of production, supplies, and transportation.

Main Responsibilities:

Data management

- Lead and participate in data remediation activities to close gaps between defined data definitions and existing data, resolving identified inconsistencies

- Establish and execute data management governance processes pertaining to supply chain operations attributes to ensure data integrity / clean master data

- Maintenance and update systems master data attribute for Supply Chain Operations, including planning, procurement, and warehousing network.

Reporting and analysis

- Analyze, develop, and implement reporting and KPI for Supply Chain Operations, including planning, procurement, warehousing network, and inventory management

- Prepare/ design monthly/ quarterly/ ad-hoc reports and Supply Chain Management Dashboard.

- Conduct advanced analysis to interpret high impact business needs and translate them into comprehensible recommendations and system requirements

- Identify trends and patterns, interpret data with clear objectives, and implement the best practices in supply chain management.

- Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests

Collaboration with other teams/departments

- Be a trusted partner and peer to our Supply Chain leaders to partner back with the core internal stakeholders/teams to deliver recommendations that address business and process improvements

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to collect data and coordinate supply chain activities.

- Develop and execute projects to enhance supply chain operations including evaluating approaches, processes, tools, and technology.
requirements:
1. Education: Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Business Administration, or a related field.

 2.Professional knowledge of:

- Understanding supply chain principles, including inventory management, demand planning, and logistics.

- Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, statistical analysis, forecast analyst skills, and strong business acumen.

- Advanced experience in pattern recognition and predictive modeling.

- Self-motivated individual capable of working independently as well as a strong team player collaborating with cross-functional teams; build relationships at all levels within the internal organization and external parties.

- Experience with advanced Excel; able to build data modeling and dashboards and analyze large data sets using different data analysis tools (e.g. Power BI, Knowing Python is an advantage).

3. Knowledge of computer servicing: Microsoft Office

4. Knowledge of foreign languages: Fluent English language skills.

5. Other (e.g. competences):

- Self-awareness and self-discipline.

- Self-planning and self-organizing.

- Strong in logical mindset.

- Strong oral and written communication skills.

6. Professional experience: At least 3 years of experience in supply chain management, data analytics, or a related field.

title: Senior Marketing Executive
job_description:
Position Objective
The Senior Marketing Executive is responsible for 
- Contributing to the development and execution of the school’s marketing strategy to drive the school’s growth goals and agenda
- Implementing multi-channel / omni-channel tactical marketing campaigns, generating quality admissions enquiries from multiple target segments based on data-driven personas
- Positioning the School as a leading American international school in HCMC of choice through media partnerships and outreach.

Responsibilities

Strategic Marketing & Research 
Senior Marketing Executive will be responsible for reviewing and aligning the marketing strategy from the Head of Marketing & Head of Admissions to both digital and offline channels which includes but are not limited to: GoogleAds, Google Analytics, Windsor AI, website Content Management System (CMS – ie WordPress VIP), Microsoft Dynamics eDM (marketing module electronic Direct Mailing), SEO/SEM, events and roadshows.
Work closely with the Head of Marketing and Head of Admissions to generate quality leads, enquiries and achieve enrolment targets.
Engage actively in professional development in order to remain current in best offline and digital marketing practices related to school communications, social media, and effective marketing and advertising strategies.
Participate in the work and success of the marketing team and provide support for school events and projects as requested.
Brand Advocacy to Stakeholders 
In addition, the position will also be overseeing all aspects of the school’s print and electronic communications through (external) vendors and freelancers, ensuring the brand equity and continuity of the school’s visual identity system, and all marketing-related activities and events to gain quality inquiries. Oversee the work of external print vendors in production of printed materials and web visuals, in collaboration with Head of Marketing & Communications
Deploy branding for the school’s internal and external usage, including and not limited to: emails, stationary, uniforms, forms and documents, handbooks, print and digital ads, email messages to sponsors, banners, backdrops, and more.

Typical Duties 
Analyze data and trends from our Google Analytics and Windsor accounts, send weekly flags and highlights to partner digital agencies and Head of Marketing for action. 
Prepare weekly and monthly report on ROAS, project statuses, current and future campaigns, and year-to-date timeline of marketing strategy and activities.
Align school’s growth goals and marketing strategy with digital effectiveness in SEM and SEO with agencies. 
Obtain competitive quotes on printing projects. Liaise and ensure the quality of print with the supplier and Head of Marketing for all materials.
Responsible for the layout, visual appearance and usability of the school website, multimedia graphics and landing pages of the School’s website.
Make consistent changes and update the website as needed
In charge of sorting the invoices and purchase orders out of marketing related suppliers.
Plan and deploy digital campaign across channel:: website, online campaigns, email marketing, social media, and digital content production.

title: Giám Sát Sản Xuất
job_description:
Suntory là tập đoàn hàng đầu thế giới trong ngành hàng tiêu dùng, sản xuất và phân phối danh mục sản phẩm đa dạng, bao gồm nước giải khát, rượu, bia và các sản phẩm chăm sóc sức khỏe trên toàn thế giới. Với lịch sử bắt đầu từ năm 1899, chúng tôi được thúc đẩy bởi một mục đích sâu sắc: Truyền cảm hứng cho cuộc sống rực rỡ, bằng cách tạo ra những trải nghiệm phong phú cho con người, hòa hợp với thiên nhiên.
Công ty TNHH Nước giải khát Suntory PepsiCo là liên minh chiến lược giữa tập đoàn PepsiCo và Suntory từ năm 2013. Tại Suntory PepsiCo VietNam, chúng tôi cam kết tạo ra một môi trường làm việc đa dạng, công bằng và hòa nhập cho tất cả nhân viên. Chúng tôi cố gắng cung cấp các cơ hội bình đẳng về việc làm, phát triển và thăng tiến bất kể chủng tộc, màu da, tôn giáo, giới tính, bản dạng hoặc biểu hiện giới tính, khuynh hướng tình dục và tuổi tác. Chúng tôi liên tục nỗ lực xây dựng một môi trường không có sự phân biệt đối xử, quấy rối và thiên vị, đồng thời chúng tôi đón chào tất cả các cá nhân ứng tuyển các vị trí tại Suntory PepsiCo.
 
Mô tả công việc
1. Sản lượng:
- Phối hợp với các bộ phận liên quan để triển khai hoạt động và kế hoạch sản xuất để đáp ứng kế hoạch sản lượng theo ngày, tuần
- Phối hợp với các bộ phận liên quan để giải quyết các vấn đề liên quan đến chất lượng, nguyên vật liệu, máy móc thiết bị trong c
- Theo dõi và quản lý máy móc thiết bị khu vực quản lý; đề xuất với bộ phận bảo trì các kế hoạch bảo trì sửa chữa & dự phòng
- Trao đổi với quản lý nhà thầu thường xuyên để giải quyết các vấn đề phát sinh trong ca 
2. KPI: 
- Kiểm soát các KPI của khu vực sản xuất trong ca và dây chuyền phụ trách; phân tích và đề xuất các kế hoạch cải thiện hiệu suất & KPI. (OEE Yield, Co2, energy,..)
- Kiểm soát & quản lý ngân sách tăng ca của dây chuyền quản lý theo quy định
- Giám sát việc tuân thủ quy trình, SOP, quy định của nhân viên và các nhà thầu làm việc tại khu vực sản xuất trong ca làm việc
- Theo dõi và đóng các điểm không phù hợp liên quan đến an toàn, chất lượng tại dây chuyền phụ trách
- Giám sát việc tuân thủ I2C của nhân viên trong ca làm việc
3. Best practice tool
- Thực thi & triển khai các chương trình thực thi hiệu quả tại dây chuyền phụ trách 
4. Dự án, thử nghiệm
- Phối hợp với các bộ phận để triển khai các dự án, thử nghiệm trong ca hoặc dây chuyền phụ trách / được phân công
5. Quản lý & phát triển nhân viên
- Đào tạo & phát triển nhân viên. Xây dựng đội ngũ nhân viên kế thừa
- Triển khai các thông tin đến các giám sát
- Sắp xếp ca làm việc & đánh giá thành tích nhân viên
- Tổ chức và thực hiện các chương trình xây dựng đội ngũ, các kế hoạch tăng mức độ gắn kết cho nhân viên
- Giải quyết các thắc mắc, khiếu nại của nhân viên
6. Báo cáo
- Thực hiện các báo cáo phân tích khi có yêu cầu
- Báo cáo ca 
7. Tuân thủ và thực thi đầy đủ mọi Nội quy Công ty, hệ thống ISO, HACCP, GMP; các quy định nội bộ và hướng dẫn trong công việc; các quy định về an toàn phòng cháy chữa cháy, các quy định về an toàn phòng cháy nổ và các yêu cầu, quy định, hướng dẫn liên quan khác về An toàn - Sức khỏe - Môi trường được triển khai và áp dụng trong hệ thống quản lý tại Nhà máy.

title: Giám Sát Hệ Thống Phụ Trợ
job_description:
Suntory là tập đoàn hàng đầu thế giới trong ngành hàng tiêu dùng, sản xuất và phân phối danh mục sản phẩm đa dạng, bao gồm nước giải khát, rượu, bia và các sản phẩm chăm sóc sức khỏe trên toàn thế giới. Với lịch sử bắt đầu từ năm 1899, chúng tôi được thúc đẩy bởi một mục đích sâu sắc: Truyền cảm hứng cho cuộc sống rực rỡ, bằng cách tạo ra những trải nghiệm phong phú cho con người, hòa hợp với thiên nhiên.
Công ty TNHH Nước giải khát Suntory PepsiCo là liên minh chiến lược giữa tập đoàn PepsiCo và Suntory từ năm 2013. Tại Suntory PepsiCo VietNam, chúng tôi cam kết tạo ra một môi trường làm việc đa dạng, công bằng và hòa nhập cho tất cả nhân viên. Chúng tôi cố gắng cung cấp các cơ hội bình đẳng về việc làm, phát triển và thăng tiến bất kể chủng tộc, màu da, tôn giáo, giới tính, bản dạng hoặc biểu hiện giới tính, khuynh hướng tình dục và tuổi tác. Chúng tôi liên tục nỗ lực xây dựng một môi trường không có sự phân biệt đối xử, quấy rối và thiên vị, đồng thời chúng tôi đón chào tất cả các cá nhân ứng tuyển các vị trí tại Suntory PepsiCo.

Mô tả công việc
1. Giám sát hoạt động bộ phận Utility trong ca để phục vụ sản xuất: Air, Steam, CO2, Chiller, AHU, Điện đạt chất lượng và an toàn.
Đưa ra quyết định và hướng xử lý khi có sự cố trong ca đảm bảo đưa máy trở lại hoạt động phục vụ sản xuất nhanh nhất và hiệu quả
Vận hành thiết bị khi cần thiết, đảm bảo hệ thống máy móc hoạt động tối ưu về năng lượng 
2. Kiểm soát theo dõi các chỉ tiêu chính:
Kiểm soát các chỉ tiêu sử dụng Energy hàng ngày như: Điện, DO, Steam, Gas, CO2.., 
Lập báo cáo hàng ngày, phân tích và lên kế hoạch hành động cải thiện các chỉ tiêu và triển khai thực hiện, và đánh giá kết quả
3. Thực hiện chương bảo trì máy móc thiết bị trong bộ phận:
Đánh giá tình trạng máy móc, thiết bị, ghi nhận các đề xuất từ vận hành.
Lập kế hoạch & tuân thủ chương trình bảo trì máy móc, triển khai thực hiện, giám sát và theo dõi và đánh giá kết quả.
Lập danh sách Spare Parts cần thiết để sửa chữa thay thế cho máy móc thiết bị gửi cho Engineering Assistant Manager (Utility)
Giám sát đảm bảo tuân thủ quy trình về an toàn, sức khỏe, môi trường (EHS) trong vận hành & sửa chữa thiết bị 
4. Quản lý hệ thống và chương trình kiểm định các thiết bị áp lực
Đảm bảo việc lưu trữ hồ sơ giấy tờ và vệ sinh an toàn tại khu vực làm việc phụ trách – sẵn sàng cho các đợt audit trong năm. 
Kiểm tra SOP/WI/OPL cho công việc vận hành, sửa chữa thiết bị tại khu vực phụ trách & triển khai đến toàn bộ nhân viên liên quan. 
5. Khác
Phân công lao động, quản lý thành tích & xây dựng đội ngũ có năng lực cao
Thực hiện quy định về an toàn lao động và phòng cháy chữa cháy, quy định GMP, CILT, 5S, ... theo tiêu chuẩn của công ty.

title: Category Manager
job_description:
Category Manager is in charge of researching goods resource and managing relationship with suppliers to choice best products at stores to satisfy customers demand:

Manage products
- Understand the market, the role of the category in the supermarket, capture customer needs, sales history, monitor the market, new trends to elaborate optimize goods assortment, in accordance with customer demand
- Select Assortment of concerned Category according company policy
- Responsible of Pricing Strategy and Price Management

Manage relationship with suppliers
- Negotiate contracts terms, trading terms with suppliers
- Negotiate seasonal area items, Purchases and promotional prices, returnable condition
- Follow up on regular basis with suppliers (targets of sales, Promos, Stock ,OOS , deliveries …)

Organize promotion program
- Elaborate program plan and follow the promotion according company policy
- Define prioritized goods, seasonal goods in promotion subject
- Propose and manage supplier promotions, consumer promotions
- Coordinate with Marketing to liasie the promotion information

Support stores and accounting department
- Support stores in solving difficulties with suppliers about delivering, goods quality, price...
- Support accounting department about invoices, documents, payment; support in settling debts with suppliers

Coordinate with other Commercial team
- Communicating with other Category Manager/ Commercial Manager in the same Department about supplier, product, project, event or campaign expectations and goals
- Collecting and analyzing feedback from stores and other Category to gauge satisfaction and success

Report
- Periodically make report as required by superior to support in purchasing: Pricing and quality according with market demand, clearly information and sufficient in quantity
- Other activities according to job requirements and assigned by superiors
requirements:
Knowledges:
- Knowledge in retail market;
- General knowledge of working environment: product range, price and planogram, customers, working procedures related
- Being sensitive to the market, quickly grasping business trends

Skills:
- Using management software, having experience using SAP / GOLD is an advantage.
- Skills in data synthesis, analysis and budgeting.
- Good communication skills, effective work organization.
- Good negotiation, persuasion and presentation skills
- Able to work under pressure and manage large amounts of information

Education: College degree or above

Experiences:
- At least 1-2 years’ experience in a similar position.
- Preference will be given to candidates with practical working experience in supermarkets, food retail chains in the field of purchasing and sales.

Personnal attitudes: Sense of business, enthusiastic, honest, dedicated in work, open, confident.

Language: Good at English is a plus

Computer skills: Microsoft Office (Words, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook…)

title: Kế Toán Viên
job_description:
Kế toán viên: 
Mô tả công việc Kế toán giá thành:
1. Lấy dữ liệu bom từ phòng kỹ thuật, phòng mua hàng hoặc dữ liệu đã có để làm báo giá cho khách. 
2. Hỗ trợ bộ phận kinh doanh cân đối chi phí giá để chốt dự án.
3. Theo dõi dự án với các bộ phận liên quan, kiểm soát giá thành mua vào để không vượt quá chi phí của dự án.
4. Tập hợp các khoản chi phí sản xuất chung gồm có: CP nguyên vật liệu, CP khấu hao (tài sản cố định, vật tư tiêu hao,…), CP nhân công + cp khác có liên quan (nếu có) để tính toán mức tổng chi phí cấu thành của dự án.
5. Sau khi thống kê và có được CP cấu thành, kế toán giá thành tổng hợp lại tổng chi phí của dự án để làm báo cáo và lấy dữ liệu điều chỉnh cho các dự án tiếp theo.
6. Thực hiện hạch toán các tài khoản kế toán có liên quan đến giá thành sản phẩm, dịch vụ đang phụ trách.
7. Hỗ trợ các bộ phận khác khi có yêu cầu.
8. Lập báo cáo tuần, tháng, quý và báo cáo sau khi kết thúc dự án.
9. Thực hiện các công việc khác theo sự chỉ đạo của cấp trên.

Mô tả công việc Kế toán mua hàng:
1. Nhận và triển khai các phiếu yêu cầu mua hàng, thiết bị đã được phê duyệt.
2. Tìm nhà cung ứng trong và ngoài nước, lấy báo giá, so sánh, đàm phán giá, đề xuất lựa chọn Nhà cung ứng phù hợp
3. Lập hồ sơ và trình ký duyệt tạo mã quản lý Nhà cung ứng phù hợp
4. Lập đơn đặt hàng khi đã được xem xét, phê duyệt từ cấp trên. Khi tiến hành mua hàng phải thông qua và được sự đồng ý về chất lượng & giá cả của Trưởng phòng Cung ứng / Giám đốc.
5. Theo dõi tiến độ đơn đặt hàng, hợp đồng mua bán với các Nhà cung ứng.
6. Lập các biên bản nghiệm thu, trình ký, hoàn tất hồ sơ , giấy tờ liên quan đến các đơn đặt hàng, hợp đồng mua bán đã được phê duyệt.
7. Thực hiện việc mua hàng đối với các yêu cầu phát sinh đột xuất hoặc số lượng ít mà nhà cung cấp không giao hàng được.
8. Cập nhật thông tin, đánh giá ( audit ) liên quan đến các nhà cung cấp: năng lực, sản phẩm, thời gian giao hàng, dịch vụ hậu mãi, phương pháp thanh toán, tiềm năng phát triển,…. để mọi thời điểm chọn được nhà cung cấp phù hợp nhất.
9. Sắp xếp kế hoạch sửa chữa máy móc – thiết bị, mua mới, đốc thúc giao hàng nhằm đảm bảo đáp ứng kịp thời yêu cầu SXKD của các phòng ban.
10. Lập danh sách và thường xuyên cập nhật thông tin nhà cung ứng với đầy đủ thông tin của nhà cung ứng.
11. Thực hiện hạch toán các tài khoản kế toán có liên quan đến nghiệp vụ mua hàng
12. Thực hiện một số công việc khác khi có yêu cầu của Trưởng phòng hoặc cấp có thẩm quyền.
13. Hàng năm đàm phán về công nợ, giá , chính sách với các nhà cung cấp.
14. Điều phối, đặt dịch vụ vận chuyển với các đơn vị Logistic, phối hợp cung cấp giấy tờ cho bộ phận khai báo Hải quan.
15. Nhận hàng, QC hàng hóa, nhập kho và xuất hàng cho các bộ phận yêu cầu.
16. Làm đề nghị tạm ứng, theo dõi và đối chiếu công nợ, làm đề nghị thanh toán đảm bảo thanh toán công nợ đúng hạn cho các nhà cung cấp.
17. Gửi báo cáo công việc hàng ngày, tuần, tháng và gửi báo cáo đột xuất khi có vấn đề phát sinh.
18. Hỗ trợ các bộ phận liên quan khi được yêu cầu.
requirements:
Yêu cầu ứng viên
1. Nữ tốt nghiệp Đại học chuyên ngành kinh tế, QTKD, Ngoại thương,... độ tuổi từ 23-30.
2. Ngoại ngữ: ưu tiên ứng viên có khả năng giao tiếp, soạn thảo văn bản, đọc hiểu tiếng Anh.
3. Không yêu cầu kinh nghiệm, nhưng có kinh nghiệm sẽ là lợi thế 
4. Sử dụng thành thạo các phần mềm tin học văn phòng (Word, Excel, Powerpoint).
5. Biết lập kế hoạch cho bản thân, kế hoạch công việc.
6. Có kỹ năng làm việc độc lập, làm việc nhóm.
7. Có tư duy, trách nhiệm, nhiệt tình, trung thực, ham học hỏi, phối hợp với các phòng ban tốt.
C. Quyền lợi của ứng viên
1. Được hưởng đầy đủ quyền lợi theo luật lao động hiện hành.
2. Thu nhập: Từ 8 triệu đến 15 triệu đồng
3. Được công ty mua thêm gói bảo hiểm tai nạn (khi bạn ốm đau phải nằm viện, tử vong,... gia đình bạn sẽ nhận được hỗ trợ max 300 triệu đồng).
4. Được tham gia bảo hiểm đầy đủ theo quy định của BHXH.
5. Thưởng các ngày Lễ, Tết, sinh nhật người lao động.
6. Được đi du lịch hàng năm theo quy định công ty.
7. Tăng lương theo năng lực, không hạn chế thời gian.
8. Được nhận các khoản thưởng thành tích, dự án,...khi đạt chỉ tiêu KPI
9. Được tham gia các khóa học đào tạo nâng cao chuyên môn trong và ngoài công ty.

title: Property Manager
job_description:
At CBRE, you are empowered to take your career path into your own hands. Our people enjoy workplace flexibility in a global organization with tremendous scale providing corporate real estate and property services. Each day you will work in an inclusive and collaborative environment with supportive teammates and be challenged to grow and be your best every day.
 
 We have an opportunity for an experienced Property Manager to be responsible for the Office and/or Residential properties. The primary focus of this role is on service quality, whilst ensuring efficient management The successful candidate will enjoy working within a great team with a defined career development pathway.
 
1. Management:

 * Receive the project handover from the Developer / Home Owner Committee or the Project Management Unit, Building Operation Management ... according to the scope of the Contract signed between CBRE and partner.
 * Interact with the Developer / Home Owner Committee and the Owner of the Apartment / customer (3rd party) to ensure the goals are met.
 * Coordinate with the relevant department to prepare, submit the Budget and control the approved budget periodically for operating costs and capital.
 * Implement the general regulations of the Company in the operation of the building. Building more relevant documents and work procedures to operate efficiently and appropriately Building Management.
 * Train for employees of Building Management to perform work in accordance with the prescribed standards and organize the management and control employees at the Building to ensure compliance with the Company / Building regulations and handle Customer requests in accordance with the quality of service standards at the Building.
 * Prepare all necessary legal notices. Propose and coordinate legal action as needed. Prepare records / documents for settlement and notify affected parties.

2. Operation control:
 
 * Respond to the needs of tenants and residents, ensure that employees of the Building Management such as engineering, fire protection, administration, customer service, security, parking, cleaning, landscape, spraying insects, swimming pools, ... effectively coordinate in providing services and solving problems promptly with customers on the basis of compliance with policies, procedures, regulations and definitions of the contract as well as CBRE's work ethic, culture and requirements.
 * Ensure periodic regular property inspection according to the list of delivery / equipment / consignment by the supplier. Recommend and/or approve alterations, maintenance and reconditioning as necessary.
 * Contract negotiation and supervise vendor services as required.
 * Perform marketing and rental, negotiate new leases / early termination contract (if necessary) and extension of the lease. Coordinate to support tenants in terms of procedures and conditions for moving-in / moving-out. Provide information necessary for the Customer to make a decision.
 * Prepare and deliver timely, accurate and complete reports as required.
 * Plan / control, proactively regulate / forecast the monthly management plan and resource preparation, ensure meeting relevant service / budget requirements and appropriately explaining the differences.
 * Control the Collection of Management Fees and related service charges. Evaluate and compare the restoration fee of the Common Area (depending on the scope of responsibility in the Management Contract).
 * Perform other duties according to the scope of authority, responsibility and assignment.
requirements:
1. Bachelor's degree of related professions. Property Management License required
2. A minimum of 4 years of experience in building management or related professions, of which at least 2 years of experience in Property Manager position.
3. Be impartial, progressive, highly responsible, aware of service, withstand high pressures.
4. Intermediate to advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite, ability to analyze, quantify, solve problems well, good judgment.
5. Good at English

title: Logistics Specialist
job_description:
Who we are:
Remember the last time you opened a bottle of cold beer after a hard day’s work or a refreshing nice-tasting bottle of soft drinks, or a bottle of our world-renowned fish sauce – a must-have in every household’s kitchen in Vietnam, well it was probably made by us.

O-I BJC Vietnam Glass Limited is a leading glass container manufacturer in Vietnam, which is jointly owned by Owens-Illinois Incorporation (O-I)- world largest glass containers manufacturer; Berli Jucker Public Co. Ltd (BJC) -Thailand’s leading commercial conglomerate; and Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Company (SABECO).

With one furnace and four production lines the company has an annual production capacity of nearly half a billion of returnable and one-way premium glass containers for Vietnam’s beer, soft drink, food, wine, spirits, and pharmaceutical products.

From engineering and manufacturing to brand development, design, and innovation, we provide unique solutions to exceed our customers’ expectations and fuel consumers’ desire for top quality, is proven to come first from glass before any other packaging choices.

Grow your career with us? Join our Life in O-I BJC Vietnam.
*Your role:
Logistics Specialist will be responsible for working with clients, international agents, shipping lines, forwarders, transporters, and warehouses to arrange all import/export shipments on time; for controlling transportation process, import/export process effectively and relevant documents exactly, systematically.

*Work location: Ba Ria Plant

*Key responsibilities:
Transportation and Delivery management
• Develop a strategic logistics plan to optimize logistics cost and transportation cost in line with company growth strategy.
• Develop plans to monitor and optimise transportation cost and exceed customer's expectation of service and delivery (OTIF).
• Execute logistics plan with outsourced transporters and warehouse team to ensure all delivery requirement to customers successfully and optimize cost from shipment/delivery combination.
• Keep tracking for all delivery and solve problem during transportation to customers.
• Manage, supervise, and evaluate transporter’s quality as well as feedback of transportation quality from customers and from other internal departments for continuous improvement.

Import-Export management
• Manage and monitor day to day Ocean/Air operating, Shipment tracing management.
• Work closely with forwarders to ensure all import / export shipments as schedule; review impact of logistics changes, such as routing, shipping modes, product volumes or carriers and report results to others.
• Check Import/Export documentation procedures (D/O, contract, B/L, Invoice, Packing list, C/O, customs clearance …).
• Resolve problems concerning transportation, logistics systems, imports or exports or customer issues; liaise with local customs for import/export; import duty, refundable tax...
• Support continuous improvement initiatives and identify inefficiencies and cost optimisation opportunities.
• Doing customs audit: Yearly health check, CFY, HS controlling…
• Implement KPI report and weekly report/monthly reports.

Safety
• Adhere and comply with all safety and health procedures and regulations, and to inform the HSE team when there is an unsafe act, situation or practice being observed; to implement HUNs and Walk and Talk requirement together.

Others
Perform any other duties as may be assigned from time to time by Logistics & Warehouse Manager.

• Working knowledge and experience within a similar field
• Previous experience working with Customs brokers, forwarders, transport provider and international partners preferred.
• Familiarity with glass manufacturing process is an advantage.

It’s a great opportunity to join a friendly management team and grow your career from an expanding international company.
